DOC.brief_title: Comparison Carvedilol Atenolol Anti-anginal Metabolic Effects Patients With Stable Angina Pectoris
DOC.detailed_description: Previous study demonstrate beta-blockers effective reduce ischemia also cardiovascular mortality follow myocardial infarction . And , recent guideline suggest potential use beta-blockers first-line agent chronic stable angina . However , beta-blockers diverse class different mechanism action physiological effect . Various pharmacologic property characterize beta-blockers include cardioselectivity , intrinsic sympathomimetic activity , concomitant vasodilating alpha-adrenoceptor blockade , might exhibit differential anti-anginal efficacy . In addition , traditional beta-blockers , particularly nonvasodilating beta-blockers , report negative metabolic effect , include hyperglycemia , insulin resistance , dyslipidemia . These unfavorable effect beta-blockers consider patient stable angina pectoris , pathophysiology coronary artery disease associate abnormality glucose lipid metabolism . Carvedilol , new vasodilating beta-blocker , show differ traditional beta-blockers term metabolic effect patient hypertension diabetes . However , data regard comparative anti-anginal metabolic effect beta-blockers without vasodilating property report , particularly patient angina pectoris . In study , simultaneously compare anti-anginal metabolic effect carvedilol atenolol patient stable angina pectoris .
DOC.criteria: Stable angina pectoris positive exercise treadmill test accord American College Cardiology Foundation American Heart Association guideline Acute coronary syndrome Coronary revascularization within past 3 month Asthma chronic obstructive lung disease Bradycardia ( heart rate < 55 beat/min ) History severe adverse reaction betablockers Symptomatic arrhythmia require antiarrhythmia therapy Heart failure Severe renal hepatic failure
